info:
## Configuration
Analyze Notification node
 * **CPaaS Credentials** - client id and client secret of your project
 * **Destination address** - the phone number that you want to subscribe to.
 * **Webhook URL** is where the notification would de delivered. Check **how to set Webhook URL** in the section below for more information.

## How to set Webhook URL
To received notification, the Analyze Notification would need a url which is accessible from the public web.
The http node exposes a POST endpoint **/webhook-endpoint** so the webhookURL would be http://localhost:1880/webhook-endpoint.
The webhook url(http://localhost:1880/webhook-endpoint) can only be accessed by another local server. To make this public
you can use [ngrok](http://localhost:1880/webhook-endpoint) which is a tunneling application.
The ngrok can be started by running this command

```
ngrok http 1880
```

Once this is run you would see something like this

```
ngrok by @inconshreveable                                                                  (Ctrl+C to quit)

Session Status                online
Session Expires               7 hours, 58 minutes
Update                        update available (version 2.3.34, Ctrl-U to update)
Version                       2.3.28
Region                        United States (us)
Web Interface                 http://127.0.0.1:4040
Forwarding                    http://29de1e3e.ngrok.io -> http://localhost:1880
Forwarding                    https://29de1e3e.ngrok.io -> http://localhost:1880

Connections                   ttl     opn     rt1     rt5     p50     p90
                              0       0       0.00    0.00    0.00    0.00
```

You need to use the https domain i.e `https://29de1e3e.ngrok.io`
The webhookURL value becomes `https://29de1e3e.ngrok.io/webhook-endpoint`.

Set this value to the webhookURL field, save and deploy the flow.

## Receiving notification
If you followed the steps correctly then you should now start receiving notification.
To test, you can send an sms to the given phone number or try sending an sms from that number.
Check the **SMS flow** example for sending sms.

For more information, check **Node Help**
